name: Bling Hustle
description:
Bling Hustle has hundreds of systems to explore, and exploit for profit.  Earn Bling by completing missions, trading commodities, and freelance hunting for bounties.  Spend bling on upgrading your ship, including 20 upgradeable weapons.  Combine different weapon upgrades to personalize your arsenal.   Enemies, shops, planets, moons, systems, and even the player's own ship are randomly generated each time you start the game.   

 A mouse and keyboard are required, and 1080p resolution is recommended.  

Saving/loading is available but not automatic.  It's requires scrolling down to use buttons not on the game canvas (and not normally visible).  Saving preserves your character/ship, with all the money, upgrades, weapons, weapon upgrades, etc to a downloadable file,  but the world will be regenerated differently the next time you load up the game.  You can take advantage of this to transport your character into different game modes.

Browser issues:  Chrome / chromium and similar browsers provide best performance.  Using fullscreen (enabled with "f" key) is recommended to avoid accidentally refreshing or navigating away from the game during moments of panic, however, depending on your exact browser setup, the vertical position of the mouse might not correctly line up with the aiming system.  From the startup menu you can click on (shoot) the "Options" planet, and then click (shoot) the "Mouse Y+" and "Mouse Y-" planets to adjust your mouse cursor until it lines up correctly with the rainbow aiming reticle.  DO THIS AFTER ENTERING FULLSCREEN MODE, BUT BEFORE BEGINNING TO PLAY.  If your cursor doesn't properly line up, the game will still mostly play fine, but the buttons / keyboard shortcuts will require clicking slightly above or below the displayed position.  

 Bling Hustle is a free open source game written in javascript by Andrew Kane.
